articles.headline: Al Franken Issues Apology After Accusation of Forcible Kissing and Groping
articles.snippet: A radio host said Al Franken, now a Democratic senator, forcibly kissed and groped her in 2006, before he took office. He then apologized.
articles.abstract: A radio host said Al Franken, now a Democratic senator, forcibly kissed and groped her in 2006, before he took office. He then apologized.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — A growing national outcry over sexual harassment reached the Senate on Thursday, when a radio newscaster accused Al Franken, Democrat of Minnesota, of kissing and groping her without consent during a 2006 U.S.O. tour of the Middle East before he took public office.

articles.headline: With AT&T and Time Warner, Battle Lines Form for an Epic Antitrust Case
articles.snippet: The Justice Department is favoring divestiture, meaning CNN might have to go. But experts say many concerns can be addressed with “conduct remedies.”
articles.abstract: The Justice Department is favoring divestiture, meaning CNN might have to go. But experts say many concerns can be addressed with “conduct remedies.”
articles.lead_paragraph: If the government goes to court to block the merger of AT&T and Time Warner, as seems increasingly likely, it may well be the antitrust case of the decade, even without the claims of presidential meddling that have already engulfed the deal in partisan controversy.

articles.headline: Alabama G.O.P. Says It Stands Behind Roy Moore
articles.snippet: Despite allegations of sexual misconduct against Roy S. Moore, the Alabama Republican Party intends to stick by its nominee for a United States Senate seat.
articles.abstract: Despite allegations of sexual misconduct against Roy S. Moore, the Alabama Republican Party intends to stick by its nominee for a United States Senate seat.
articles.lead_paragraph: BIRMINGHAM, Ala. — The Alabama Republican Party on Thursday offered unqualified support to the embattled candidacy of Roy S. Moore, ignoring the condemnation of national Republican leaders and brushing aside worries that he could lose a Senate race in a solidly conservative state — or be expelled from Congress if he wins.

articles.headline: Downing North Korean Missiles Is Hard. So the U.S. Is Experimenting.
articles.snippet: Buried in an emergency funding request to Congress lie hints of new ways to confront Pyongyang, like cyberweapons and armed drones.
articles.abstract: Buried in an emergency funding request to Congress lie hints of new ways to confront Pyongyang, like cyberweapons and armed drones.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Concerned that the missile defense system designed to protect American cities is insufficient by itself to deter a North Korean attack, the Trump administration is expanding its strategy to also try to stop Pyongyang’s missiles before they get far from Korean airspace.
articles.byline: By David E. Sanger and William J. Broad

articles.headline: In Puerto Rico, Law Passed for Fiscal Crisis Hampers Storm Recovery
articles.snippet: When the hurricane-ravaged island needs Washington’s help most, 2016 legislation that set up an oversight board is restricting federal authority.
articles.abstract: When the hurricane-ravaged island needs Washington’s help most, 2016 legislation that set up an oversight board is restricting federal authority.
articles.lead_paragraph: As Puerto Rico faced a fiscal crisis last year after racking up $123 billion in debt and pension liabilities, Congress passed special legislation to give it relief from creditors and time to find its financial footing.

articles.headline: Tesla Unveils an Electric Rival to Semi Trucks
articles.snippet: Aiming to remake a multibillion-dollar industry, the automaker said it would have a semi for sale in two years that would be nearly self-driving.
articles.abstract: Aiming to remake a multibillion-dollar industry, the automaker said it would have a semi for sale in two years that would be nearly self-driving.
articles.lead_paragraph: HAWTHORNE, Calif. — Tesla has aimed to reinvent the automobile and the way electricity is generated for homes. With those efforts still in progress, it is setting out on another quest: to remake the multibillion-dollar trucking industry.

articles.headline: China’s Soccer Push Puts a Storied Team Under Murky Ownership
articles.snippet: Fans of Italy’s A.C. Milan greeted its new owner as a savior. Today, as the debt-burdened team bleeds money, questions swirl around its new benefactor.
articles.abstract: Fans of Italy’s A.C. Milan greeted its new owner as a savior. Today, as the debt-burdened team bleeds money, questions swirl around its new benefactor.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — When the Chinese businessman Li Yonghong bought A.C. Milan, the world-famous Italian soccer club, virtually nobody in Italy had heard of him.
articles.byline: By Sui-Lee Wee, Ryan Mcmorrow and Tariq Panja

articles.headline: Confused by the Tax Bills? Be Glad You’re Not an Accountant
articles.snippet: Pity the tax adviser trying to calm anxious clients while struggling to figure out what Congress may or may not do.
articles.abstract: Pity the tax adviser trying to calm anxious clients while struggling to figure out what Congress may or may not do.
articles.lead_paragraph: For people even mildly inclined toward tax nerddom, the continuing discussions in the Senate and the debate that already took place in the House of Representatives are the best kind of spectator sport.
